** CONTINGENCY - NOT IN EFFECT - CHAPTER 371 OF 2002 **
The Crisis Response System shall include:
A crisis communication center in each jurisdiction or region to provide:
A single point of entry to the Crisis Response System;
Coordination with the local core service agency, police, emergency medical service personnel, and mental health providers; and
Services that may include:
Emergency services including:
Mobile crisis teams to provide assessments, crisis intervention, treatment, follow-up, and referral to urgent care, and to arrange appointments for individuals to obtain public mental health services;
Urgent care; and
Emergency psychiatric services;
Follow-up services including:
Mobile treatment teams to provide outreach services on location;
Individualized family intervention teams; and
Residential crisis services;
Community awareness promotion and training programs; and
An evaluation of outcomes of services through an annual survey by the Administration of consumers and family members who have received services from the Crisis Response System.
The Crisis Response System services shall be implemented as determined by the core service agency serving each jurisdiction.
An advance directive for mental health services under § 5-602.1 of this article shall apply to the delivery of services under this subtitle.
This subtitle may not be construed to affect petitions for emergency evaluations under § 10-622 of this title.
